column2: lillyrose07, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I found it very helpful & such a relief!  I actually lost a good job because of my IBS and in desperation asked my Dr for something that could help.  Now I'm hoping to find another job fast, no luck so far...  The pharmacies in Des Moines, IA don't carry donnatal but have to special order it for me.  The Dr wrote me a 'script for donnatal extend tabs but that had to be special ordered and is WAY too expensive for me as there is no generic available.  So I have to get the generic of plain donnatal.  I asked & researched for another drug that does the same thing but is more available; my research & my pharmacy told me there is no such drug.  Generic donnatal should be more available as IBS is a very crippling problem - surely it's not a rare condition!

column2: tummygurl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have used this medication in both liquid and pill forms for the last 10 years and only use it as needed when my colon goes into full spasm. The liquid form brings immediate relief - the pill form takes longer to work but is obviously easier to travel with.  Although I'm allowed 4 doses a day, I find relief usually after taking the first pill and I am fully functional to go about my day in just an hour or two. If I have to take a second dose 4 hours later, I experience enough doziness to not drive.  I rarely stay in spasm longer than a day at a time. The only regular side effect I have is a "bounceback" from severe cramping/diarreha to a system shutdown resulting in constipation 7 days after taking the medication.

no signifacant result

column2: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Donnatal for almost 6 months and it has helped my symptoms of IBS. It is a good medication. My doctor was hesitant because there is phenobarbital in it, but we came to an agreement and it also helps with my anxiety, one thing I am worried about is that there is a withdrawal symptom from the phenobarbital, it can cause seizures! Each Donnatal tablet hads 16.2mg of phenobarbital in it and it also has low amounts of hyosciamine, scopolomine, atropine. I just works really well. I am taking it before meals and at bedtime and my diarrhea has calmed down and I only use the bathroom once a day!

column2: Mary P, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I suffer from inflammation of my digestive tract and recently underwent several medical tests and visits to the ER for SEVERE pain. On 1 of my visits to the ER they gave me a dose of GI Cocktail (Maalox, Donnatol and Lidocaine). It did wonders for my pain and after talking to my GI specialist he gave me a RX for this med and since beginning taking this med on a daily basis, I feel 90% better! Coodos!
